unnormalised: A minor fire broke out on the 12723 Hyderabad-New Delhi Telangana Express near Ballabgarh on 16/08/2024 at approximately 14:30 hrs, causing a brief disruption to rail traffic. Initial reports suggest the fire started in the B-3 coach, likely due to a short circuit. No casualties were reported, thankfully.
normalised: A minor fire broke out on the one two seven two three Hyderabad-New Delhi Telangana Express near Ballabgarh on sixteenth August two thousand and twenty four at approximately fourteen thirty hours, causing a brief disruption to rail traffic. Initial reports suggest the fire started in the B-three coach, likely due to a short circuit. No casualties were reported, thankfully.

unnormalised: Passengers onboard described a scene of panic as smoke filled the compartment. "There was a sudden commotion, and people started shouting 'Aag! Aag!'", recounted Mrs. Lakshmi Reddy, a passenger travelling to Agra. "Luckily, the train stopped quickly, and everyone was evacuated safely."

unnormalised: The incident resulted in delays for several other trains on the Delhi-Agra route. The 12621 Tamil Nadu Express was held up at Palwal for over 2 hours, and the 12002 Bhopal Shatabdi was rerouted via a different line. Passengers on the Telangana Express were provided with alternative travel arrangements to reach their destinations. Some were accommodated on other trains, while others were given the option of a full refund.

unnormalised: Indian Railways has announced a compensation of Rs. 5000 to each passenger affected by the delay. Further, a helpline number, 139, has been set up for passengers seeking information about train schedules and alternative arrangements. The railways ministry has also assured a thorough safety review to prevent such incidents in the future.
